Nothing says comfort and confidence in quite such an attractive way as Italian loafers. The famously well made and beautifully designed shoes coming out of Italy have stood as the height of luxury for generations. And, as you’ll see in this list, nothing has changed.

Well, that’s not quite true because globalization has transformed the production of the best Italian loafers for men. That’s led to some strange questions about what actually counts as an Italian loafer. Is it a loafer whose leather (or suede) comes from Italy? Or one that was made in Italy? Nobody, truth be told, is quite sure.

In this list of the best Italian loafers for men, I’m going to recommend 6 amazing pairs of shoes that all share in the heritage of Italian loafers. Some of them are 100% Italian; others feature Italian leather but were produced elsewhere. After all, the style and quality of a shoe is what matters most at the end of the day.

Let’s jump right in and see if we can’t help you find your next favorite pair of men’s Italian loafers.

Key Takeaways

I’ve owned, worn, and tried on more pairs of Italian loafers than I can count. And, after looking back on all those different pairs and checking out a ton of new options, I’m quite happy with the list of 6 standout loafers that I’ve put together.

Overall, I placed the Myrqvist Stenhammar II at the top of this list as the best Italian loafers for men. The dark brown calf leather is simply top class, and the classy design will look just as good with a suit as it will as part of a more casual outfit.

I’ve also recommended a more casual pair of loafers, the Scarosso Ludovico Loafers, as well as, on the opposite extreme, the more explicitly formal Oliver Cabell Penny Loafers. The other options have several different styles and approaches, so I’m sure that you’ll be able to find a version of the loafers you’re picturing.

  2. Buying Considerations
  3. How We Chose

  5. Final Verdict
  6. FAQs

Best Overall: Myrqvist Stenhammar II

Why they’re great: These incredibly cool, brown calfskin Italian loafers are a great way to make a statement, whatever you’re wearing. I’ve worn them with both suits and casual attire and never gotten an odd look (even when casual means jeans and a T-shirt).

I really like the dark brown calf version of these shoes, but you can also check out the black calf, black suede, or brown suede options.

Who are they for? I’d say that, basically, anyone with a discerning taste in men’s footwear would love to have these excellent loafers in their closet. They’re some of the best Italian loafers for men.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: There’s not anything interesting in the form of tassels or metal clasps going on with these shoes, which might be something you’re looking for.

Why they’re great: The Velasca Brugnon Loafers are both incredibly stylish and unbelievably comfortable on your feet. Everything in these shoes is leather, including the soles, which means that they fit your feet so well that you won’t have a problem standing or walking around in them all day.

Who are they for? These are some of the best Italian loafers for men. They have an eye-catching shape and tassel as an accent, which makes them a great choice if you like that style.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: The character is quite obvious on these deer leather loafers (meaning that they have a rougher texture than smooth leather), which isn’t really a flaw but more of a very distinctive feature.

They’re made from incredibly soft and comfortable suede and come in a variety of colors that are generally more appropriate for the boat than the boardroom. And, a nice extra-nice touch is the calf-skin interior.

Who are they for? Anyone who’s looking for a pair of swanky Italian loafers to do some hardcore chilling in should take a look at these.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: Honestly, this is a product for which the wealth of color options you have can make actually choosing one to go with difficult.

Who are they for? If you’re a fan of ease and comfort when you’re dressed up, look no further.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: These are among the best Italian loafers for men. However, there’s a small white tag on the outside edge of the shoe, which I think provides a great accent, but others might feel that it’s misplaced.

Buying Considerations for the Best Italian Loafers For Men

Material

The main question you have—in terms of material—when shopping for Italian loafers is whether to go for leather or suede loafers. Both options are great, to be honest, but they do offer different benefits to someone wearing the shoes.

Suede is incredibly soft and comfortable, and it’ll immediately start morphing to fit your feet when you first put them on. However, that does mean that they’ll start to wear out more quickly than leather loafers, especially if you wear them often and walk a lot in them.

Leather loafers, on the other hand, have a lot more structure to them. They also tend to go better with formal attire, whereas suede shoes are more of a leisure thing.

Color

Once you’ve decided on the material that you want for your loafers, you then need to pick out what color you want them to be. Some men will prefer the more limited and conservative colors that leather loafers come in, and others love the sometimes outlandish options you have with suede loafers.

Where and when you’re planning to wear the loafers you’re shopping for, as well as the types of outfits you’re planning to wear them with should be your first guide to what color to choose.

If you’re planning on wearing them to work or other formal settings, then I’d recommend going with a black or dark brown leather loafer. But if you’re getting a pair of loafers for a summer vacation, then you can definitely think about a wider range of colors.

Size

Finally, ensuring that you’re getting the right size is essential when you’re shopping for loafers. You should always be sure to consult the brand’s sizing advice, as this can help you make the right decision.

It’s also crucial to think about the unique features of your feet that aren’t represented in your size. Are your feet narrow or wide? What types of shoes have you been comfortable in before? Answering all these questions before you make a purchase can help you get a comfortable pair of shoes you love wearing.

How We Chose

The best Italian loafers for men are an investment in the true sense of the word. Not only are they expensive, but they’re also a clothing item that you want to last for a long time. That’s why getting good advice before you buy is essential, and it’s also why we put together this article.

We chose the products on this list based on the quality of the materials used to make them, the hardiness of their construction, and whether or not they embody the timeless design of Italian loafers. We also considered the following four factors, ensuring that all the products and brands we recommended hold up to them.

Brand Reputation: We’ve recommended only reputable brands that have a long history in creating excellent loafers.

Customer Reviews: All the products on this list have overwhelmingly positive reviews from real customers who have bought the specific shoes in question.

Price: All the products on this list offer real value to match their price tag.

Transparency: The brands we’ve featured here are all up-front and transparent about the most important questions, from the origin of their materials to their shipping and return policies.

Why Trust Us?

We here at FashionBeans all really love Italian loafers. We collectively own dozens of pairs of Italian loafers, some of which we love and some of which were definite disappointments.

By putting all the experience we’ve had with Italian loafers into the creation of this list, we’re confident that you can be confident ordering any of the products we’ve recommended.

We went over hundreds of products and read thousands of customer reviews when putting this list together. That means that the six pairs of Italian loafers we’ve recommended represent a tiny fraction of all the products we considered. Rest assured that only the absolute best Italian loafers for men made it onto this list.

Final Verdict 

The Myrqvist Stenhammar II is, if you ask me, the best of the best Italian loafers for men that you can buy online right now. They have a classic yet edgy design that really makes a statement.

But there are lots of other great choices on this list, and you can’t really go wrong with any of them. Make sure to enjoy your new loafers, whichever you go with.
